text: Hemme one is Helen here today I'm going
to make a really delicious and
refreshing summer noodle salad dish is
called Photoshop me it's actually made
with the pho noodles but instead of the
big broth we're going to use the fried
beef and it's going to be soaked with a
lot of fresh vegetables and herbs and
the sweet and sour tamarind sauce going
to bring the dish to the whole new level
so let's begin
you're gonna need final gram of beef
thickness light against the grain you
can use filet mignon or i/o proud season
the beef with a tablespoon of minced
garlic and shallots 1/3 teaspoon of salt
a teaspoon of chicken stock
half a teaspoon pepper oyster sauce and
vegetable oil about a tablespoon edge
and also a teaspoon of tapioca or corn
starch the starch and the oil will keep
the meat tender mix really well cover
and chill in the fridge for about 30
minutes
next in a small saucepan add about
avakov Optimo ring pops and 2 cups of
water
bring to a boil and use spatula or spoon
to break up the tamarind chunks you want
to boil the tamarind pops for about 5 to
10 minutes until they break cups then
strain through a sieve to get the
tamarind liquid you want to force as
much of the tamarind through the sieve
as possible and don't forget to scrape
down the bottom of the sieve discard the
leftover or fibrous pot hit a wok or pan
on medium and add 1 to 2 tablespoons of
butter if you don't have butter you can
use vegetable oil instead add a
tablespoon of minced garlic and fry onto
your fragrance mmm it smells so good
then add equal amounts of good tamarind
liquid sugar and fish sauce so we can
have a balance between sweet sour and
savory then you can have a taste and
make adjustments I also add a little bit
of chicken stock and some chili flakes
for more heat
then turn off the heat and let it cool
next add some oil in the pan and stir
fry some minced garlic until fragrant
then cutting the beef and stir-fry
quickly on high heat until is no longer
pink you really don't want to over cook
the beef otherwise it would turn really
gummy so as soon as is turned quite
brown you can turn off the heat cook the
for another following the package
instructions and then drain really well
toss the noodles with some vegetable oil
to prevent sticking and separate them to
assemble the bowl add a handful of the
noodles and drizzle the delicious sweet
and sour tamarind sauce over give it a
really good mix so the noodles is well
coated with the sauce add some blanch
bean sprouts and favorite Vietnamese
hurts like means Vietnamese palm also
called Falcon yellow or sweet Basil's
then top with the stir-fried beef and a
sprinkle of roasted crushed peanuts and
a few chilli slices for more color and
heat some chilli gems would also be a
great accompany mmm it looks so good and
it tastes even better what a healthy and
refreshing noodle salad a great spring
and summer delights I hope you like it
and if you do don't forget to click like
and subscribe to my channel for more
delicious Vietnamese food thank you for
watching bye bye
